intro: Labatia lasiocarpa, commonly known as the rough-hairy labatia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, as well as showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. The fruit is a capsule that releases small, wind-dispersed seeds.
